alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 1:55PM EST until January 03 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to two feet deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 18 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EST Friday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
